evolution_stages.conversation_summary: Discussed: 1) Severe presentation anxiety (virtual/recorded), 2) Homesickness-study guilt conflict, 3) Coding intimidation for career goals, 4) Focus challenges from environmental disruptions. Solutions: Accepted 15-min study chunks with customized playlist, tea break rewards, and graduated coding approach starting with HTML. Progress: Demonstrated immediate application by creating first HTML code, scheduled concrete next steps (color implementation Thursday), reframed journalism investigation as exciting project, and established anxiety tracking system. Student showed reduced anxiety through active solution co-creation (adjusting time intervals), successful code implementation, and enthusiastic commitment to portfolio vision.

evolution_stages.conversation_summary: Problems discussed: 1) Debilitating presentation anxiety (virtual/recorded), 2) Homesickness interfering with study focus, 3) Overwhelm when starting coding. Solutions offered/accepted: Gradual exposure to presentations (30-second videos), structured study blocks (15-min work + 5-min tea breaks), and simplified coding path (freeCodeCamp HTML). Student's response: Casey co-created solutions by adjusting timeframes, selecting calming study music, and implementing environmental controls (library/earplugs). Evidence of progress: Successfully wrote first HTML code during session, established measurable anxiety tracking system, scheduled study blocks with personalized reminders, and demonstrated problem-solving by identifying library as distraction-free zone. Further showed engagement through portfolio folder creation and scheduled follow-up for skill advancement.
